intro: Iostephane trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a cluster of disk flowers, typical of the genus. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Iostephane trilobata is typically found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
